<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update table="x_0586_til_post">
    <x_0586_til_post action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE">
        <category display_value="Tricks">a8c6c0be1b8154908ed631d7dc4bcbef</category>
        <github_id>92</github_id>
        <github_url>https://github.com/iamkalai/SNTIL/issues/92</github_url>
        <message>If you ever wanted to do a quick test of event management and wanted to simulate an event, you can use the below script.

```javascript
var event = {
"source": "EMTest",
"node": "V-W2K3-32-Web02",
"type": "SNDemo",
"message_key": "My Message Key",
"severity": "2",
"description": "memory leak I/O disk error",
"status": "3",
}
var script = new sn_em_ai.EvtMgmtEmEvent(event);
script.createEvent();
```

**Note**: You can add any information to 'additional_info' field of the event by specifying a key that doesn't exist in em_event schema. The above example adds status key value pair to additional info.
</message>
        <number>TIL0001094</number>
        <status>old</status>
        <sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by>
        <sys_created_on>2022-03-11 14:52:16</sys_created_on>
        <sys_id>f0b5eea32f86851051dad5f62799b6d5</sys_id>
        <sys_mod_count>2</sys_mod_count>
        <sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by>
        <sys_updated_on>2022-04-04 07:43:38</sys_updated_on>
        <title>Simulate an event for event management</title>
    </x_0586_til_post>
</record_update>
